description: The 'draw_divide_items_into_array' function generates an image of a rectangular array of items, where the number of rows and columns are specified by the user. This visualization tool is designed to help students understand the concept of multiplication as repeated addition and division as partitioning.
example_usage:
# Example usage for draw_divide_items_into_array
result = draw_divide_items_into_array(data)

stimulus_type_specification.title: Available Images: Rectangular Arrays
stimulus_type_specification.description: The images generated by this function show a rectangular array of items, with each item represented by a colored circle. The number of rows and columns in the array can be adjusted to represent different multiplication and division problems. For example, an array with 3 rows and 4 columns can represent the multiplication problem 3x4=12 or the division problem 12÷3=4. By visualizing these problems in this way, students can gain a deeper understanding of these fundamental arithmetic operations.

details: Rows and columns form a rectangular array.
Each row is separated by a border.
Number of rows in the array.
Number of columns in the array.

stimulus_type_specification.educational_purpose: The main educational purpose of this function is to provide a visual aid for understanding multiplication and division. By seeing the items arranged in a rectangular array, students can more easily grasp the concept of multiplication as repeated addition (i.e., adding the same number multiple times) and division as partitioning (i.e., dividing a set of items into equal parts). This can help to build a strong foundation for more advanced mathematical concepts.
